name: machicolation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a series of holes in a floor that projects (= sticks out over the edge) around the top of a castle, through which the people inside can drop or throw objects with the intention of causing injury or damage: Medieval fortifications became progressively stronger, with the increasing use of machicolations. The outer wall is topped with a machicolation.
More examplesFewer examplesHe built an elegant gallery on the south side, and false machicolations on the other.A machicolation jutted out from the parapet just above the tower door.It was then that I saw the machicolations in the floor of the chamber.
